wikipedia_page.main: Helen Louisa Kerr LLD JP (9 March 1859-8 February 1940) was a Scottish social reformer.

response: Laird was appointed to the Women's Committee on House Planning in Scotland in 1918. The Committee had been established by the Secretary for Scotland, Robert Munro. with the purpose of inspecting houses and making recommendations from the housewife;s point of view... Its Chair was Helen Kerr.
Notable residents include George Angus (architect) (1), Thomas Guthrie Wright (6), Helen Kerr (6), and Andrew Rutherfurd, Lord Rutherfurd (9).
